Ad Text:
Senior AI Engineer

We are seeking an experienced AI Engineer to design, develop, and scale intelligent systems that drive meaningful business outcomes. This role combines strong data engineering foundations with modern AI and cloud technologies and is well suited to someone who thrives in dynamic, evolving environments.

What you’ll be doing

Design and deliver high-quality, resilient software with strong automation, testing, and security built in from day one
Bridge experimental AI and production-grade engineering through rigorous evaluation frameworks and best-practice design
Lead the design of features and non-functional requirements, ensuring scalability, reliability, and proactive security remediation
Implement automated testing pipelines to ensure safety, accuracy, and compliance within regulated environments
Document solutions clearly, share knowledge openly, and take ownership of resolving complex technical challenges
Contribute to planning and requirements analysis, even when requirements are ambiguous or evolving
What you bring

Demonstrated experience designing and delivering AI-driven applications, including RAG and GraphRAG architectures
Strong proficiency in Python for building production-ready systems
Practical experience with vector databases, data ingestion pipelines, and chunking strategies for complex, domain-specific datasets
Strong DevOps mindset with hands-on experience in cloud infrastructure and automated CI/CD pipelines
Solid understanding of LLM-specific observability, including model performance monitoring, drift detection, and cost optimisation
Why this opportunity?

Collaborative, values-driven leadership environment
Hybrid work model built on flexibility and trust
Opportunity to contribute to an organisation that values clarity, trust, and genuine expertise



We are an inclusive employer committed to fostering a diverse and accessible workplace. We encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disabilities, LGBTQIA+ individuals, people of all ages, and those from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.

About us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


About the opportunity:

As LMA continues to expand its Australian portfolio, we are growing our team of talented Verification & Validation (V&V) Engineers. In this role, you will help shape and mature a modern, digitally enabled V&V environment supporting complex engineering projects and Integrated Product Teams across our Integrated Air and Missile Defence, Maritime, and Aeronautics portfolios.

You will play a key role in delivering incremental system verification for major Defence programs, ensuring quality, compliance, and confidence in engineering outcomes. Working within a collaborative, cross-functional team, you will plan, coordinate, and execute system-level test activities that underpin capability assurance.

Key responsibilities include:

Own key V&V artefacts including the V&V Plan, Verification Cross Reference Matrix (VCRM), and Acceptance Test Plans and Procedures

Design and document the V&V digital thread, ensuring end-to-end traceability from requirements to test evidence

Plan, manage, and execute system-level verification activities across the engineering lifecycle

Build and maintain strong relationships with engineering teams and external stakeholders

Develop a deep understanding of system capabilities, architecture, and requirements to inform effective verification strategies

 

About you: 

​​​​​​​You bring a strong background in V&V or systems engineering within Defence or other complex technical environments. You value collaboration, structured problem-solving, and technical rigour, and you enjoy tackling verification challenges across multi-disciplinary engineering teams. 

To succeed in this role, you’ll bring: 

A degree in Engineering or equivalent relevant experience

Demonstrated experience in systems engineering, integration, and V&V on complex systems

Knowledge of one or more Defence domains: Command & Control, Command Support, or Intelligence, Surveillance and Reconnaissance (ISR)

Working knowledge of MBSE practices and tools (e.g., DOORS, Rhapsody, ETM)

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum engineering environment

An Australian NV-1 security clearance and ability to access/handle Export Controlled technology, data and information


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

Job Title: Systems Engineer Opportunities - Defence and Advanced Technology Programs
Ad Text:
About Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, we believe that when people are empowered, inspired, and supported, they can achieve extraordinary things. We embrace flexibility, so our people can be their best inside and outside of work. We champion inclusion and continuous learning, ensuring all voices are heard and valued. And we thrive on collaboration, turning challenges into opportunities for growth and innovation. As a leader in national security, our innovative and diverse programs create a more secure future for Australia across space, air, land, sea, and cyber domains. Every day is a chance to solve the world's most complex challenges and make a profound impact. Experience it here.


Systems Engineer Opportunities – Defence and Advanced Technology Programs

We’re expanding our engineering team and have new Systems Engineer openings across a range of advanced Defence and technology programs.

As a Systems Engineer, you’ll help shape next-generation capability by applying Model-Based Engineering (MBE) to design, develop and integrate complex systems. You’ll work closely with specialists, partner organisations and cross-functional teams to deliver solutions that strengthen Australia’s Defence and national security outcomes.

About the Role:

In this role, you will:

Analyse and transform system and sub-system requirements into detailed designs within an MBE environment.

Define and manage system interfaces, ensuring full traceability throughout the design lifecycle.

Conduct trade studies and optimise design solutions against performance, cost, and schedule considerations.

Produce and maintain technical artefacts — including design descriptions, requirements documents, and analysis reports.

Participate in design reviews and support project planning, stakeholder engagement, and engineering assurance activities.

Contribute to estimates, bids, and continuous improvement initiatives across programs.


About You:

You are a capable Systems Engineer who enjoys tackling complex technical problems and working in multidisciplinary teams. You’ll bring: 

Demonstrated experience across the systems engineering lifecycle, including requirements, design, integration, and verification.

Knowledge of MBSE approaches and tools such as MagicDraw, Rhapsody, Cameo or similar.

Experience working on complex systems, ideally within Defence or high-technology environments.

Strong analytical, modelling, and documentation skills.

A collaborative mindset with the ability to mentor or support junior engineers.


Why Join Us:

At Lockheed Martin Australia, you’ll work on programs that push the boundaries of innovation, engineering excellence and mission capability. Whether you’re passionate about systems design, integration, digital engineering or model-based development, you’ll have opportunities to learn, lead and grow.

Be part of something bigger — help shape the future of Defence systems and advanced technology.

Apply now for one of our Systems Engineer opportunities.


How we reward and support you: 

When you join Lockheed Martin, you work on projects you won’t experience anywhere else.

We offer you a range of benefits built to suit you, no matter what stage of life you are in. 

Flexible work & Hybrid work options

Access to our online discounts program offering immediate discounts or cashback

A variety of leave options including Purchase Leave to support you and your family  

Additional benefits such as Annual Flu Vaccinations, Novated Leasing and Fitness Programs


Special Requirements:

Applicants must be eligible to obtain and maintain an Australian Defence Security Clearance and employment may be contingent on the provision of further personal information including citizenship to ensure compliance with international export control legislation and regulations.

A Veteran-friendly Workplace:

Veterans are encouraged to apply. We highly value the unique skills and experiences that veterans and transitioning service members can contribute to our team. We are proud to be recognised as a Veteran Friendly Employer by the Australian Government.

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Lockheed Martin Australia supports Equal Employment Opportunity and values diversity in the workplace by creating a place of employment that is, free of unlawful discrimination and is harassment free, fair, ethical, inclusive, and values the contribution of all its employees. By leveraging our employees' unique talents and experiences, we will deliver innovative, affordable solutions and unparalleled customer value.

As part of our endeavours to increase participation of Indigenous Australians, we welcome applications from all people, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.

We are committed to creating a workplace where everyone can thrive. If you are selected for this role, we would be happy to discuss any accommodations that will help you to be successful.

This role sits at the intersection of AI, data engineering and analytics, and is ideal for someone excited about applying LLMs and modern AI tooling to real-world business problems. Help build and fine-tune next-generation AI solutions that support data, reporting and operational insights.

Description

The Role

You'll work within a high-impact data and analytics team focused on improving reporting, data quality and operational decision-making through AI. A key part of this role is fine-tuning and optimising AI models, and integrating them into a modern cloud data platform built on Snowflake.

Key Responsibilities

Design, develop and fine-tune LLM and AI solutions

Build AI-driven workflows that enhance reporting and data processes

Develop and maintain Python-based data and AI pipelines

Write and optimise SQL on Snowflake

Work with large, complex datasets to improve data quality and accessibility

Collaborate with data, analytics and business stakeholders to identify AI opportunities

Contribute to best practices for AI governance, reliability and scalability

Profile

What We're Looking For

Strong Python development experience
Hands-on experience working with LLMs / Generative AI
Strong SQL skills and experience working with Snowflake
Experience building or fine-tuning AI/ML models in production environments

Ideal Experience

Background as a Data Scientist, Machine Learning Engineer or AI Engineer
Experience deploying AI solutions into cloud environments
Exposure to MLOps, prompt engineering or model optimisation
Experience working with reporting, analytics or enterprise data platforms
Experience in the mining or resources sector is highly regarded

Job Offer

Salary sacrificing
Employee Assistance Program (EAP)
Corporate discounts

About Brunel:

Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world. We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical, professional, trades and craft disciplines, pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract, permanent or secondment basis.

Operating in Australasia since 1997, Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth, Sydney, Brisbane, Melbourne and Port Moresby, which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning over 45 countries, 120 offices and 50 years of successful operation.

Brunel is proud to be equal opportunity employer and encourages applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander and female candidates.

Do you have questions?

If you have any questions or would like to discuss the details of this role, please contact Terence Gomes on t.gomes@brunel.net

MinRes can offer you! 

ASX 200 Company - A dynamic global leader with cutting edge innovation 
We invest in your career, with a focus on leadership, upskilling, training and development programs 
Live Your Best Life!  Our benefits offer you access to deals, support and discounts to help you unlock the important things in Life – Health, Family, Recreation and Your Future with MinRes 


The opportunity

Join the dynamic AI team at MinRes as an AI Engineer, where you will play a pivotal role in transforming operations across our mining, logistics, and corporate environments. In this hands-on position, you will design, develop, and deploy scalable AI solutions to drive performance, safety, and productivity across the business.

You will collaborate seamlessly with data engineers, product owners, business partners and frontline teams to turn ambitious ideas into real-world, high-impact AI outcomes. Your focus will be on building AI products that are not only technically robust but also adopted and valued at every level.

If you are passionate about experimentation and delivering practical, scalable solutions that make a genuine difference, we want to hear from you.
This position will commence as a 12-month fixed term contract.

 

Your primary responsibilities:

Build, train, and fine-tune AI/ML models for use cases including condition monitoring, computer vision, predictive maintenance, document intelligence, and GenAI automation.
Develop and deploy AI applications using Databricks, Python, n8n, and cloud-native tools.
Collaborate with Data Engineers to source, prepare, and label datasets.
Experience with DevOps practices and tools ideally Azure DevOps, Terraform Cloud, Azure & AWS
Design and implement MLOps workflows for version control, deployment, and monitoring.
Contribute to MinResAI (a ChatGPT-style interface) with LLM features such as RAG, summarisation, and workflow automation.

 

What is required

Bachelor’s or master’s in computer science, Data Science, Engineering, or a related field.
Certifications in cloud platforms (Azure, AWS), Databricks, or AI/ML technologies are desirable.
Extensive full stack development experience inclusive of AI Development experience in a business or industrial setting
Mining domain knowledge would be highly desirable
Hands-on experience with AWS or Azure, SQL, Python, ML frameworks, Databricks and n8n is essential
Familiarity with CI/CD for model deployment, and data pipelines.
Experience with CV models (e.g. YOLO, OpenCV) is desirable
​​Uses initiative, demonstrates resilience and a continuous improvement mindset and proactive approach to problem solving  
​​Understanding of system integration techniques and complexities​ ​ 

 

About Mineral Resources 

MinRes is a leading diversified resources company with extensive operations in lithium, iron ore, energy and mining services across Western Australia. With a focus on people and innovation, MinRes has become one of the ASX’s best-performing companies since listing in 2006. 

Our headquarters at 20 Walters Drive sets a new standard for workplace wellness.  World class facilities include a café, restaurant, commercial gym, crèche, daycare and health centre, including GP. 

At MinRes, the future's bright. Be part of our next chapter.

The Company

Harry The Hirer is Australia’s leading events company. For 40+ years, we’ve powered the country’s most iconic events: Australian Open, Formula 1 Grand Prix, MotoGP, Melbourne Cup.

Build and operate production-grade AI infrastructure that operators trust and the business depends on.

We compete on speed and quality. We’re building production AI systems that dramatically reduce turnaround times while maintaining our design excellence, the goal is to streamline and push the limits of what’s possible.

The Role

Define together with the company stakeholders  how a large organisation adopts AI, then build the frameworks that make it happen independently.

You’ll create the playbooks, blueprints, and self-service processes that let department managers identify, scope, and implement AI workflows .

This is strategic architecture with immediate execution. You shape the vision, then you ship it.

Success metrics: Departments use your playbooks independently - Future projects deploy using your templates - Demonstrated time savings and team adoption within first 3 months

Must Have

•          Designed solutions bridging business strategy and technical execution

•          Created frameworks that enabled organisational independence (not dependency)

•          Worked directly with stakeholders and managers on transformation initiatives

•          Built playbooks, templates, or systems others could use without you

•          Comfortable with tight scope control and explicit criteria

Nice to Have

•          Experience transforming non-tech industries through AI

•          Background in events, logistics, design, or creative production

•          Worked in owner-operated businesses

•          Deployed AI in resource-constrained environments

•          Built adoption frameworks with measurable ROI

About You

You are: - A systems thinker who ships production solutions, not theoretical diagrams - Energized by creating leverage through frameworks - Comfortable measuring success by adoption rates and time savings

Reality check: - This is an established company, not a startup - Architecture flows through a single point of authority - Regular leadership review with CEO/CFO - Trust earned through conservative rollouts and proven value - Priorities can shift based on business needs

The Details

Reporting to: AI Systems Lead
Location: Melbourne (Abbotsford, on-site )
Start: ASAP

Apply: [simonel@harrythehirer.com.au]

Include in the email Subject : “AI solution Architect”

Include your resume and answer: “Describe a framework or system you designed that enabled others to work independently. What made it successful?”

Join a forward-thinking team dedicated to building scalable, secure, and high-quality data platforms using the latest Microsoft technologies.
Enjoy flexible working opportunities that promote work-life balance, and professional growth through training programmes and mentorship initiatives.
Make a tangible impact by collaborating with cross-functional teams to deliver advanced analytics capabilities that inform strategic decision-making across the organisation.


As a Data Engineer based in Melbourne, your day-to-day activities will involve designing scalable data lakes using Azure technologies, developing sophisticated ETL/ELT workflows for diverse datasets, and collaborating with multidisciplinary teams to deliver actionable insights. You will play a key role in embedding rigorous governance frameworks while ensuring optimal performance of all data assets.

Develop, optimise, and maintain complex data pipelines
Buid scalable ETL/ELT processes that enable seamless movement of data from diverse sources into centralised repositories for analytics and reporting purposes.
Ensure comprehensive data quality, governance, and security measures are embedded throughout all stages of the data lifecycle, adhering to best practices and compliance standards.

What you bring:

To excel as Data Engineer in this role, your background should include deep familiarity with Microsoft's suite of analytics tools-particularly those focused on storage, orchestration, transformation, and visualisation. You will have demonstrated success managing complex projects involving multiple stakeholders while upholding rigorous standards for quality assurance


Extensive experience in data engineering or related fields with a proven track record of delivering enterprise-grade solutions in complex environments.
Deep expertise in Microsoft Azure Synapse Analytics, Azure Data Lake Storage, and SQL Server for building end-to-end data platforms.
Advanced proficiency in Python programming language as well as strong command of SQL for querying large datasets efficiently.
Demonstrated ability implementing robust data governance frameworks using tools like Purview while maintaining high standards for security and compliance.

What's next:

If you are ready to take your career as a Data Engineer to new heights within an inspiring environment in Melbourne, this is your chance to make a lasting difference.

Apply today by clicking on the link provided-your next rewarding challenge awaits!


Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples are encouraged to apply.

To apply, please click apply or email John Riordan at john.riordan@robertwalters.com.au for a confidential discussion.

Great Permanent opportunity for a Data Architecture & Strategy Lead to join a high growth technology first Scale up based in Sydney, flexible hybrid role.
We’re partnering with a high growth, technology led financial services scale up that is investing heavily in its data platform to support the next phase of business growth, automation, and AI driven capability.

The Opportunity
This is a hands-on senior data leadership role where you will own data architecture and strategy end to end, with a clear mandate to fix foundational issues, modernise the data stack, and build the platform required to scale with confidence. If you enjoy solving hard data problems, making pragmatic architectural decisions, and balancing speed, cost, and long-term value, this role will suit you.

You will take ownership of the core data architecture and work closely with engineering, product, and business leaders to design and implement a modern, scalable data foundation. This role is execution focused and not purely advisory. You will be expected to design, build, and stabilise key components yourself.

You will also play a critical role in enabling future AI, automation, and advanced analytics use cases by ensuring the right data foundations, governance, and observability are in place.

What You’ll Be Doing

Data Architecture and Platform Strategy
• Own and evolve the overall data architecture and technical direction
• Make clear build vs buy decisions based on cost, latency, and business value
• Re architect legacy ETL and ELT pipelines to improve freshness, reliability, and cost efficiency

Automation and AI Enablement
• Design data ingestion and serving layers to support modern automation and AI workloads
• Account for latency and reliability requirements beyond traditional BI and reporting
• Prepare the data platform to support future RAG and agent-based use cases

Data Governance and Quality
• Establish practical data contracts with product and engineering teams
• Drive data quality ownership to the point of creation rather than downstream cleanup
• Implement data observability, lineage, and traceability to improve trust and explainability

Commercial and Cost Ownership
• Own data platform costs and vendor decisions
• Balance innovation with cost discipline and operational efficiency

What We’re Looking For

Strong experience in data architecture and hands on data engineering/ Science leadership
• Proven ability to modernise data platforms in scaling or complex environments
• Experience making pragmatic architectural decisions under real business constraints
• Solid understanding of modern data stacks, cloud data platforms, and automation
• Exposure to unstructured data, AI adjacent workloads, or advanced analytics is highly regarded
• Strong stakeholder management skills and the ability to influence without authority
• A lean, outcome focused mindset over technical perfection
Interviews for this role will be starting next week so if you would like to know more about the company and opportunity apply Today and ill give you a call. For more information speak to Jamie at Preacta recruitment 0401488853

Company Description


Join the team redefining how the world experiences design.

Hey, g'day, mabuhay, kia ora, 你好, hallo, vítejte!

Thanks for stopping by. We know job hunting can be a little time consuming and you're probably keen to find out what's on offer, so we'll get straight to the point.

Where and how you can work

Our flagship campus is in Sydney. We also have a campus in Melbourne and co-working spaces in Brisbane, Perth, Adelaide and Auckland. But you have choice in where and how you work, we trust our Canvanauts to choose the balance that empowers them and their team to achieve their goals.

Job Description


What you’d be doing in this role

As Canva scales change continues to be part of our DNA. But we like to think that's all part of the fun. So this will give you the flavour of the type of things you'll be working on when you start, but this will likely evolve.

This role will see you:

Building world-class AI infrastructure to support a 100+ person research team at the forefront of creative AI

Designing and scaling multi-cloud systems that support high-performance model training and inference

Partnering across AWS, GCP, Cloudflare and GCore to optimise GPU compute environments

Enhancing CI/CD pipelines and developer velocity within our AI platform teams

Improving monitoring, alerting and system observability for AI workloads

Driving alignment in DevOps best practices across the AI platform and CORE engineering teams

Leading a high-impact engineering team in a fast-paced, cutting-edge environment

You're probably a match if

You’ve led DevOps or infrastructure teams, ideally in AI or high-performance computing environments

You’re experienced with AWS (ECS, EC2, S3, IAM) and multi-cloud environments like GCP, Cloudflare or GCore

You’ve worked with Kubernetes, SLURM, or similar distributed training infrastructure

You’re fluent in infrastructure as code tools like Terraform

You understand the lifecycle of AI models and how to support R&D at scale

You have a strong grasp of containerisation, Linux fundamentals, and cloud networking

You’re collaborative, curious, and passionate about enabling others to move fast and safely

About the team

You’ll be joining CORE (Canva Original Research & Exploration) — our in-house AI research lab. CORE brings together researchers, engineers, and infrastructure specialists to build world-class models that unlock creativity at scale. With over 100 researchers already in the team, this role is foundational to scaling our AI training and inference capabilities as we push the boundaries of what's possible in product-integrated AI.


What's in it for you?

Achieving our crazy big goals motivates us to work hard - and we do - but you'll experience lots of moments of magic, connectivity and fun woven throughout life at Canva, too. We also offer a range of benefits to set you up for every success in and outside of work.

Here's a taste of what's on offer:

Equity packages - we want our success to be yours too

Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents & carers

An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance to support your wellbeing, social connection, office setup & more

Flexible leave options that empower you to be a force for good, take time to recharge and supports you personally

Check out lifeatcanva.com for more info.

Other stuff to know

We make hiring decisions based on your experience, skills and passion, as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. When you apply, please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

We celebrate all types of skills and backgrounds at Canva so even if you don’t feel like your skills quite match what’s listed above - we still want to hear from you!

Please note that interviews are conducted virtually.

Join our team as a Domain Architect in the Autonomous Networks, where you will drive the design and implementation of complex solutions. You will work with cutting-edge technologies. This role offers an opportunity to work with global teams, provide technical guidance, and drive innovation in security architecture. As an Architect, you have an opportunity to drive the team with AI powered initiatives to enhance the productivity.

Advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world.

Nokia is a global leader in connectivity for the AI era. With expertise across fixed, mobile and transport networks, powered by the innovation of Nokia Bell Labs, we’re advancing connectivity to secure a brighter world. 

Learn more about life at Nokia.

Our recruitment process

We act inclusively and respect the uniqueness of people. Our employment decisions are made regardless of race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, marital status, disability, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by law. We are committed to a culture of inclusion built upon our core value of respect.

If you’re interested in this role but don’t meet every listed requirement, we still encourage you to apply. Unique backgrounds, perspectives, and experiences enrich our teams, and you may be just the right candidate for this or another opportunity.

The length of the recruitment process may vary depending on the specific role's requirements. We strive to ensure a smooth and inclusive experience for all candidates. Discover more about the recruitment process at Nokia. 

Develop a Requirement Definition Document (RDD), High-Level Design (HLD), and Low-Level Design (LLD).
Stay updated on customer architecture within the dedicated technical area and regional requirements.
Apply solution architecture standards, processes, and principles.
Define and develop the full scope of solutions, working across different teams and organizations to create effective outcomes.
Work effectively in diverse environments, leveraging best practices and industry knowledge to enhance products and services.
Drive projects with manageable risks and resource requirements or oversee small teams, managing day-to-day operations, resource allocation, and workload distribution.
Act as a key troubleshooter and subject-matter expert on the assigned product portfolio, including fulfilment, assurance, inventory, security, and assessment.

Must have:

Bachelor's degree or equivalent with 10+ years of experience in architecture.
Experience in at least one or two domains like 
Orchestration/ fulfilment / FlowOne /CDPA / CDFF /NOrC 
Assurance/NAC. 
Inventory UIV, Discovery and Reconciliation domain. 
SSO/Security product suites/NIAM. 
Analytics
Hands-on experience in 
Java, Python, Expect scripting, 
Dockers, Kubernetes, Microservices, Databases, Kafka
XML, XSLT, Data Parsing, 
SNMP, REST, SOAP, CORBA, LDAP, JMS, and FTP.

Good to have:

Understanding of 5G Slicing, 5G SA/NSA network, IP/MPLS, Optics, IMS, VoLTE, NFV/SDN, Fixed network
AI / ML concepts, LLM models 
Hands on with Agentic frameworks like LangChain, LangGraph, CrewAI or AutoGen
MCP, FastAPI protocols
